22-023TI.summary: Recommendation to approve the minutes from the Technology & Innovation Commission meeting held Wednesday, July 27, 2022.A motion was made by Commissioner Vinzant, seconded by Chair Shaffer, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 5 - Lisa Mae Brunson, Justin Hectus, Parisa Vinzant, Gwen Shaffer and Robb KorinkeAbsent: 1 - Javier Ortiz2.

22-024TI.summary: Recommendation to receive and file an update on the distribution of the Technology & Innovation Commission white paper titled "Analysis and recommendations for regulating facial recognition technology and other Page 1 of 4TELECONFERENCE, 3:30 PMWEDNESDAY, AUGUST 24, 2022CITY OF LONG BEACHTECHNOLOGY AND INNOVATION COMMISSION MINUTES"smart" devices and platforms", and the Equity and Human Relations Commission recommendations related to the City's use of Facial Recognition Technology, and to discuss next steps for distribution and outreach for both documents.Lea Eriksen, Director of Technology & Innovation, spoke.Commissioner Vinzant, spoke.Lea Eriksen, Director of Technology & Innovation, spoke.Commissioner Vinzant, spoke.Lea Eriksen, Director of Technology & Innovation, spoke.Commissioner Vinzant, spoke.This agenda item was approved.Yes: 5 - Lisa Mae Brunson, Justin Hectus, Parisa Vinzant, Gwen Shaffer and Robb KorinkeAbsent: 1 - Javier Ortiz3.

22-025TI.summary: Recommendation to receive and file a presentation on the development of a digital rights platform minimum viable product, as part of the Smart City Initiative.Lea Eriksen, Director of Technology & Innovation, spoke.Ryan Kurtzman, Smart Cities Program Manager, spoke.Commissioner Hectus, spoke.Ryan Kurtzman, Smart Cities Program Manager, spoke.Chair Shaffer, spoke.Ryan Kurtzman, Smart Cities Program Manager, spoke.Chair Shaffer, spoke.Ryan Kurtzman, Smart Cities Program Manager, spoke.Chair Shaffer, spoke.Lea Eriksen, Director of Technology & Innovation, spoke.Commissioner Vinzant, spoke.Ryan Kurtzman, Smart Cities Program Manager, spoke.Commissioner Vinzant, spoke.Ryan Kurtzman, Smart Cities Program Manager, spoke.A conversation ensued between Commissioner Vinzant and Ryan Kurtzman, Smart Cities Program Manager.Commissioner Hectus, spoke.Commissioner Vinzant, spoke.Lea Eriksen, Director of Technology & Innovation, spoke.Chair Shaffer, spoke.Page 2 of 4TELECONFERENCE, 3:30 PMWEDNESDAY, AUGUST 24, 2022CITY OF LONG BEACHTECHNOLOGY AND INNOVATION COMMISSION MINUTESCommissioner Vinzant, spoke.A conversation ensued between Commissioner Vinzant, Chair Shaffer, Commissioner Hectus, and Ryan Kurtzman, Smart Cities Program Manager.This agenda item was approved.Yes: 5 - Lisa Mae Brunson, Justin Hectus, Parisa Vinzant, Gwen Shaffer and Robb KorinkeAbsent: 1 - Javier Ortiz4.
